snippet: Israel recently traded more than a thousand Palestinian prisoners for Gilad Shalit, but deals like that may soon be over.
abstract: Israeli Defense Minister Ehud Barak says that Israel, which traded 1,027 Palestinian prisoners with Hamas for soldier Gilad Shalit, is planning on establishing stricter guidelines for handling negotiations regarding abducted soldiers that would prevent it from making such a lopsided exchange in the future.
lead_paragraph: Israel recently traded more than a thousand Palestinian prisoners for Gilad Shalit, but deals like that may soon be over.

headline.seo: After Shalit, Israel Changing Prisoner Exchange Rules
headline.main: Israel Plans New Rules on Exchange of Prisoners
headline.print_headline: Israel Plans New Rules On Exchange Of Prisoners
